content.description: Climb the boulder problem start to the first bolt (stickclip recommended). The climbing eases up but remains enjoyable through 3 more bolts to the independent set of anchors.
content.location: This is the scooped out face between Nimrod's Son and Middle Age Crisis.

content.description: Stem and jam the wide crack in the dihedral.
content.location: The dihedral directly right of Lost Tradition.

content.description: 15 feet of easy climbing leads to the 1st bolt.  Then, sustained delicate climbing on rounded edges lead past three more bolts to the anchors.  Very fun.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor shared with Lip Cancer on the right.

content.description: stick clip the first of 4 bolts and begin a bouldery thin sequence on crimps, a distinct knob and good feat up to the first bolt. the crux comes right after the first bolt, then easies off.
content.location: the line of bolts immediately to the right of Stems and Seeds.

content.description: Climb the thin dihedral crack using laybacks, stemming, jamming, or anything that works.  Great route on great rock.  Prone to wetness in the spring.
content.protection: Gear to 3".  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the right end of Area B, this is the thin dihedral crack where 2 black walls come together.

content.description: Climb the overhanging handcrack through and over a bulge.  Then, continue in a thin left facing dihedral crack to top out.  Good rock.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  Rap off trees or traverse over to a 2 bolt anchor to the right to rap.
content.location: Near the right end of Area B, this is the overhanging handcrack leading to a dihedral, on the face right of Stems and Seeds.

content.description: Vertical face climbing takes you past four bolts, arching slightly left towards the small arete near the top.
content.location: On the wall right of the unmistakeable Stems & Seeds and the perpetually wet wall next to it.  It is the middle line of three bolted lines.  it is the second bolted line to the left of the obvious dihedral crack, Tying the Knot.

content.description: Originally a gear line. Begin on pockets that lead on to easy terrain. Retrobolted in 2014
content.location: Directly right of Middle Aged Crisis

content.description: Fun climb that is deceptively slopey.  Some small pimples in the rock make for some surprisingly good holds.  Eases into jugs at the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts and an anchor -- first bolt is very high and above some delicate moves -- stick clip encouraged
content.location: First bolt line to the left of the corner route "Stems and Seeds"

content.description: Short but fun route up the seasonally wet black streak. Only detracting factor is the shortness - two fun cruxes down low. I would recommend a stick clip if uncomfortable at the grade.

Start below the obvious, left-trending flake and follow that diagonal bolt line along the flake.  Once the flake ends, head straight up through the water streak. This route is pumpy down low with a lot of false jugs.  It becomes very slopey and balancy in the final moves just before the chains.
content.location: Route is maybe 10 yard right of Stems and Seeds up the hill and starts below the large, left-trending flake.

content.description:
Next area past the Flat Fields Slab but before the Meat Walls. Contains the Arkansas classic Stems and Seeds. Though the area hosts some great climbing, finding many of these routes dry can be challenging. It is best to check this area in the fall when the runoff isn't so bad. Many of the routes also have sloper/friction cruxes that will feel much easier in colder weather.

 The area offers varying degrees of sun and shade throughout the day, much like the rest of the crag. The west facing walls will have morning shade and afternoon sun, but the canopy does an ok job of shading them.  the east facing walls get a little shade in the morning, get pretty sun blasted during the day, then get a little more shade later in the afternoon.
